comments.body: Did you confirm that this isn't called when the pointer is nil?
What should happen if both are nonempty?

If they are both non-empty we should probably force the legacy fields to
match the subsets.  I think I just let some corner cases go here since they
are unlikely to happen (I think)

On Thu, Mar 26, 2015 at 10:21 PM, Brian Grant notifications@github.com
wrote:

> In pkg/api/v1beta1/defaults.go
> https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/kubernetes/pull/5939#discussion_r27276557
> :
> 
> > @@ -93,7 +96,42 @@ func init() {
> >         },
> >         func(obj *Endpoints) {
> >             if obj.Protocol == "" {
> > -               obj.Protocol = "TCP"
> > -               obj.Protocol = ProtocolTCP
> > -           }
> > -           if len(obj.Subsets) == 0 && len(obj.Endpoints) > 0 {
> 
> What should happen if both are nonempty?
> 
> â€”
